Title: Engineer in Training - Brampton, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Your Employer:
Dare to join Englobe
Terraprobe Inc., member of Englobe Corp. is looking for an
Engineer in Training
to join our team at our
BRAMPTON
office. The candidate will be a member of a team providing scientific consulting services to private industry and government clients. This position will support a wide variety of projects, and the candidate would be working in the
Environmental and Hydrogeological Groups
.
Englobe and Terrabrope, and its more than 2,600 people, are concerned about the environment daily, engage in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.
At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.
We offer
Annual reimbursement of sports expenses
Opportunities for skills development
Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours
Dare to join Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.
Your Contribution:
As an Engineer in Training, you will work in collaboration with the Environmental and Hydrogeological Teams.
Reporting to the Project Managers, your main tasks will be to work in the field to get familiar with aspects of environmental engineering. More specifically, you will:
Be responsible for conducting, writing and/or managing Phase I and II Environmental Site Assessments;
Complete or assist with the completion Screening level of risk assessment;
Conduct and/or manage environmental Site Remediation projects including underground storage tank removals, soil excavation projects, groundwater treatment, confirmatory soil and/or groundwater sampling;
Participate in work plan preparation, proposal writing, budgeting, scheduling;
Prepare and file reports and record of site conditions as per O. reg 153;
Be familiar with indoor air quality assessment and/or hazardous materials is considered an asset.
Your Profile:
*
Must be registered or eligible to be registered as EIT (Professional Engineers Ontario) or GIT (Professional Geoscientists Ontario).
1-3 years of relevant experience
Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Engineering, Civil Engineering or Hydrogeological Engineering; a post-graduate degree will be considered an asset
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Products (Word, Excel, Outlook)
Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
Location: 11 Indell Lane, Brampton, ON
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Process/ Process Control Engineer - Quesnel, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
West Fraser is an industry leading forest products company. Recognized for the eighth time as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers, we are a growing company looking for talented people to be part of our team. Are you interested in working for a company that offers both a challenging work environment and a rewarding career path? Our corporate office in Quesnel, BC has an opportunity for a:
PROCESS/PROCESS CONTROL ENGINEER
Our Pulp team is seeking a process/process control engineer with strong technical, leadership, planning, organization, and interpersonal skills. This is a unique opportunity for a Chemical Engineering graduate to grow their career working in several pulp mill operations. The successful candidate must be mobile and willing to travel to the communities where we have our pulp operations: Hinton and Slave Lake, AB. In this position, you will provide engineering support in implementing our high-performance human machine interface (HMI) and alarm rationalization project.
Key responsibilities include:
Assist in implementing HMI and Alarm Rationalization in West Fraser’s four pulp divisions
Related short/long term project planning
Evaluating and troubleshooting the pulping process
Evaluating and troubleshooting the Delta V distributed control system (DCS)
Loop tuning
Process control evaluation and improvement
As the successful candidate you must have:
A Chemical Engineering degree from an accredited institution; other disciplines may be considered
Previous experience in pulp and paper or other manufacturing industries would be considered an asset
Experience in loop tuning and process control improvement would be considered an asset
Experience with high performance HMI and alarm rationalization would be considered asset
Be able to communicate effectively in oral and written form with all levels of the organization
Problem solving and project management skills
Demonstrate the ability to work independently and as part of a team
Possess a desire to progress, learn and succeed
Embody the West Fraser traits of integrity, respect, humility, competitiveness, and frugality
West Fraser Timber has over 60 locations across Canada, the United States and Europe. We believe strongly in promoting from within and pride ourselves on providing an environment that provides for opportunities to build your skill set and continuous development. The successful candidate should be interested in future growth opportunities within the company. West Fraser offers an excellent compensation package including a competitive salary, excellent benefits and an outstanding pension plan.
Quesnel is a modern community of approximately 20,000 people offering terrific lifestyles for individuals and families. Relocation assistance is available. Our region is an outdoor enthusiasts’ paradise, with exciting activities from skiing, snowmobiling, camping, hiking, fishing, hunting, and ATV’s. Quesnel features a full-service acute care hospital, major retail and restaurant chains, sports facilities, pools, community parks, and educational institutions for pre-school through post-secondary. To learn more, visit the Town of Quesnel web site: www.quesnel.ca.
If this position sounds like the start of a career for you, submit your cover letter, resume, and transcripts/proof of qualifications at www.westfraser.com/jobs click "apply now" in green at the top of the page.
For more information on West Fraser and other career opportunities, visit our website at
www.westfraser.com/jobs
.
We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Structures/Analysis Engineer - Markham, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Location:
Multimatic Technical Centre, Markham, Ontario, Canada
Posted:
September 1st, 2021
OVERVIEW:
Located in Markham, Ontario, Canada, Multimatic Technical Centre (MTC) is part of Multimatic’s Engineering Group. MTC provides advanced design, simulation, testing and prototyping services to Multimatic’s production divisions and to Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM’s), niche vehicle manufacturers, motorsports organizations, military equipment contractors and consumer products companies.
MTC houses key engineering, testing and development capabilities under one roof, enabling rapid turnaround and tight integration between departments (vehicle systems engineering, production engineering, predictive methods, product testing and validation, composites, fabrication and prototyping). Additional specialized services utilize MTC’s full-vehicle multi-post test rig, and a proprietary vehicle dynamics simulator. These services are further enhanced by the capabilities of a fully-equipped motorsports department.
The Analysis Department at MTC is currently seeking a
Structures/Analysis Engineer
. Note that this position is not remote based; the candidate needs to work onsite at our Markham location.
Facility Address:
85 Valleywood Drive, Markham, Ontario L3R 5E5
Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop and evaluate analysis models for components, assemblies and full vehicles. This will involve constructing finite element analysis (FEA) models, performing simulations, reviewing results, generating reports and making/ exploring recommendations for design improvements. Throughout the development process, the Structures Engineer will have to work closely with other members of the team including Design Engineers, Test Engineers, manufacturing personnel and OEM customers.
Education and Experience:
University degree in a relevant engineering discipline (i.e. mechanical, mechatronics, or automotive engineering)
Experience level open: new grads to experienced engineers (1 - 8+ years). Compensation level based on experience
Mechanical/mechatronics/systems analysis (CAE) experience (automotive preferred)
Good knowledge of the finite element method and its application to the analysis of mechanical systems
Experience with commercial FEA tools (e.g. Hyperworks, ABAQUS, LS-DYNA, OptiStruct)
Experience using multi-body kinematics and dynamics packages (e.g. ADAMS, MotionView, etc.) is an asset but not required
High level of interest in automotive engineering
Good written and verbal communication skills
Excellent organizational skills
Effective problem solving skills
Hold current passport and be able to travel as/ when required

Title: Planning & Design Technologist 2 - Kelowna, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Affiliation:
MoveUP
Employment Status:
Full-Time Regular
Salary:
$2,951.00 bi-weekly
We’re looking for new talent to join us as we reinvent the future of energy. Across BC, we have a diverse team of more than 2,500 employees we can’t do without, yet we’re growing as fast as ever.
You may think we’re your standard utility that delivers natural gas and electricity, but we’re also into cool, innovative energy solutions. Think carbon capture, renewable energies and lower-carbon transportation for a start. We believe in creating a cleaner, healthier tomorrow.
If you like meaningful work, a dynamic environment and forward-thinking colleagues, build your career with us. You’ll get opportunities to grow, lead, solve, and create. So what are you waiting for? Let’s rethink energy together. Position Overview
The purpose of this position is to plan, estimate and coordinate project requests from premium key accounts (e.g. builders and developers), external agencies, FortisBC departments, as well as end-use customers, where the projects present the greatest complexity. This role works both independently and with guidance to develop designs for distribution projects of the greatest complexity. This position prepares pricing and cost estimates and conducts field reconnaissance for related projects. The role is a liaison with customers, contractors, developers and others in matters related to alterations, renewals, upgrades, improvements and additions to the distribution systems.
Responsibilities
Coordinates projects, including but not limited to:
defining customer requirements and project scope, creating and maintaining customer data,
ensuring all service product requirements are collected,
explaining FortisBC processes, procedures and requirements to customers,
selecting the appropriate service products and pricing,
conveying related permit requirements to customers,
informing the customer of the price for the service product(s),
scheduling the work with the customer following a check of crew (capacity planning) and materials availability and creating work orders.
Processes jobs, including but not limited to:
reviewing foreign utility data, legal land-base considerations and geography to determine appropriate gas layout and depth in accordance with FortisBC standards,
drafting written work procedures (per company standard OHS 03-14) for manager’s review and approval,
completing electronic layout or Engineering drawings,
confirming and updating pipe sizing on drawings as defined by System Planning,
identifying and obtaining required internal and external approvals and prerequisites,
identifying and requisitioning required inventoried materials and manufactured items,
completing detailed estimates,
utilizing economic test tools to determine pricing of installations,
explaining FortisBC procedures, policies, rate processes and municipal, provincial and federal regulations to customers,
working with customers and authorities to ensure all service products requirements are collected and met,
scheduling the work with the customer by checking for crew availability using the capacity planning information.
Projects will include vertical subdivision designs.
Ensures completion of the job and maintains customer relations, including but not limited to:
building relationships with current, repeat and potential customers and external contacts,
responding to customer inquiries including but not limited to installation costs, bill calculations, and the scheduling of work,
acting as primary contact for premium rated builder/developers and internal/external customers.
Responds to a variety of operational and maintenance issues which may include (but are not limited to):
overbuilds of plant related to all customer classes and identified by both the customer and company programs,
metering consolidations/de-consolidations,
meter protection,
commercial/industrial metering assembly upgrades (company driven),
corrosion maintenance (houseline/riser replacement, anode bed install/removal),
IP/TP service line additions/removals,
complex main and valve lowerings, raisings, and/or abandonments,
activities related to hazard remediation and system maintenance requirements.
Provides direction to Planning and Design Technicians and Technologist 1’s within the department.
Performs duties of a minor nature related to the above duties, including driving a vehicle, which do not affect the rating of the job.
Requirements
Minimum post-secondary educational requirement - completion of a post-secondary Technology Diploma in an appropriate discipline.
Certified or deemed eligible for certification at the technologist level by the Applied Science Technologists and Technicians of British Columbia (ASTTBC).
Four (4) years directly related relevant work experience (a minimum of two (2) years typically gained as a Planning and Design Technologist 1).
Demonstrated strong organizational skills including the ability to multi-task, prioritize and work under pressure during peak workload periods in order to meet tight deadlines.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills including telephone call handling skills and the ability to respond to difficult or demanding situations with tact and diplomacy.
Demonstrated courteous, professional manner in dealing with internal and external contacts and customers, including positive interpersonal skills and the ability to provide direction in a team environment.
Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems of a technical nature, and understand the implication of costs, risks, operability and safety.
Demonstrated sound working knowledge of various specialized software applications required to support operations activities (e.g. SAP) and the MS Office suite of applications.
Demonstrated knowledge of natural gas utilization and construction practices.
Demonstrated superior customer service and product promotion skills.
Demonstrated ability to work independently.
Demonstrated sound analytical and decision making skills.
Capable of keyboarding at an intermediate level.
Valid British Columbia Drivers license.
Our engaging workplace offers a wide range of challenging opportunities, while being safe, inclusive and diverse. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, while supporting life-long career development. We also encourage volunteerism and nourish the need to give back to your community.
The safety of our customers and FortisBC family members is our number one priority. To ensure the safety of our employees on our job sites, there is strict adherence to our worksite safety plans and social distancing practices. As an essential service provider, we’ll continue to follow the government COVID-19 guidelines and adjust our plans as necessary. As we welcome new employees, our commitment to safety remains for all of our FortisBC family.
To learn more about the recruitment process with FortisBC, please visit the You’re Applying. What now? page for additional information.

Title: Junior Communication Systems Engineer - Dartmouth, NS - Indeed.com
Description:
JUNIOR COMMUNICATION SYSTEMS ENGINEER
Located at 35 Mic Mac Boulevard, Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, B3A 4Y8 Irving Shipbuilding has a proud history as Canada’s shipbuilder. A proud member of the J.D. Irving, Limited family of companies, we have been building quality vessels and fabricated modules for more than 50 years, and our Halifax Shipyard has been at the forefront of Canadian shipbuilding for 130 years.
Since 2012, we have invested more than $400 million in facilities, people, processes, and technology, making Halifax Shipyard one of the most modern and capable shipyards in the world. Over the next 30 years our shipbuilders will construct 23 modern patrol ships and surface combatants for the Royal Canadian Navy as part of Canada’s National Shipbuilding Strategy, the largest defence procurement in Canadian history.
This year, we will deliver the lead Arctic and Offshore Patrol Ship, the largest Navy ship built in Canada in 50 years. And we’re just getting started. We’re growing our team with career-defining opportunities that will revitalize Canada’s shipbuilding industry and provide Canada’s sailors with the ships they need to protect Canada’s interests at home and abroad. Our workforce of over 2,000 will grow to more than 2,800 at peak construction of the Canadian Surface Combatants.
We have built more than 80% of Canada’s current combatant fleet and continue to perform maintenance and modernization work on the ships, including the Halifax-class frigates.
This is a permanent, full-time role based in Halifax Regional Municipality, Nova Scotia. The primary language of work is English.
This entry level position will be part of the ISI team responsible for ensuring the communications systems deployed on the Canadian Surface Combatant (CSC) ships are designed, developed, integrated, tested and accredited to support the needs of the Royal Canadian Navy.
Responsibilities:
Support the Communications Capability Manager in ensuring a complete and fully compliant product is provided in accordance with relevant governing standards and CSC requirements applicable to Communications systems.
Support the Communications Capability Manager in provision of engineering oversight and guidance during requirements definition, design, integration, and test activities of Communications equipment to ensure that fully compliant and certified solutions are provided in accordance with sound engineering practice.
Provide support in evaluating engineering change proposals submitted by the sub-contractors to ensure that performance, cost, schedule and Canadian Content impacts or risks to integration activities are understood and recorded.
Support the coordination of scheduling, planning and conduct of integration activities in support of related program milestones.
Participate in the CSC Integrated Product Teams (IPT) structure, in partnership with the Combat Systems Integrator (CSI) and vendors, including occasional travel if required.
Provide expertise, knowledge and insight into the development and / or review of design and products to support integration, installation and test of Communications equipment.
Provide accurate status reports on assigned activities to the Communications Capability Manager.
Establish and maintain strong working relationships with internal (Shipyard Production, CSC Program personnel) and external stakeholders (subcontractors and Canadian government representatives).
Support a culture of teamwork, pro-activeness, and enthusiasm within the Combat System team, and be a role model for professional behavior.
Qualifications:
Education Required: Engineering Degree or equivalent (e.g. Electrical, Electronic, Mechatronic or Computer Engineering)
Years of Experience Required
A minimum of Engineering Degree or equivalent experience
Experience in engineering for Naval platforms
Understanding of ship construction
Experience working in design, production, and test within a ship construction program
Technical or Project Management certification is considered an asset
Military service is desirable
All successful applicants must meet requirements for Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP), Canadian Government Security clearance, and U.S. International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR).
What We Offer:
Irving Shipbuilding is proud to offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including but not limited to:
A flexible medical, dental, and vision plan;
Employee & Family Assistance Programs;
RRSP matching program;
Health & Wellness reimbursements;
Opportunities to take part in job related training and development;
Growth and progression opportunities within Irving Shipbuilding and the larger network of the JD Irving group of companies.
Please be advised that some positions within our business have been designated as ‘Safety Sensitive’ where the employee holding the position has a heightened responsibility for his/her own safety or the safety of others due to the nature of the job. If this is the case, you will be informed in the interview process.
To Apply for this Career Opportunity:
Please complete the online application form. An up-to-date resume of past experience and education is required.
All applications will be reviewed by one of our recruiters. If the recruiter sees a potential opportunity (current or future) that matches your skills and experience, you will be contacted to discuss your qualifications for a position with Irving Shipbuilding
We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: T - Process Engineer - Richmond Hill, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
ABOUT US
Trans-Northern Pipelines Inc. (TNPI) operates regulated pipelines in central Alberta from Edmonton to Calgary, and in the South Eastern Ontario to Montreal corridor, delivering refined petroleum products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, aviation fuel and heating fuel used by businesses and consumers.
We have been operating pipelines for more than 70 years and are committed to operating in a safe and environmentally responsible manner in order to protect the public, the environment and the pipeline.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
TNPI offers a stable work environment with predictable business growth. The organization serves a committed client group made up of 3 major Oil & Gas companies and benefits from consistent and growing Canadian demand for petroleum products.
TNPI has a culture that supports personal initiative, and is a place where employees have considerable autonomy and ownership of their functions. The flat organizational structure allows for broad mandates and the opportunity to expand your skills and experience, as well as access to decision makers and senior leadership. The TNPI culture is collegial, values employee input, and supports work/life balance. TNPI achieves operational excellence in four pillars: Safety, Environment, Reliability and People.
POSITION SUMMARY
The Engineer, Process (temporary) is responsible for daily, project, emergency, and integrity related tasks for both pipeline and facility support. The engineer primary focus is base business support with emphasis on safety, reliability, and productivity. The engineer delivers completed projects on time, on budget, within a prescribed scope, and to a high quality of work. The engineer may be a technical subject matter expert, and is responsible for a wide variety of technical support functions within the company; including pipeline operations, measurement system performance and process control. Provides support by maintaining engineering standards, specifications, procedures and related records. The process engineer also promotes continuous improvement through participation in industry groups and sharing lessons learned.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Budget, design, coordinate, schedule, track department projects for new or modified pipeline facilities and pipeline maintenance
Deal with third party concerns and maintain the integrity of the pipeline system
Predict the requirement for projects, budget and forecast for future necessity
Preparation of engineering specifications as required and ensure compliance and integrity of design
Understand and apply to project activities the proper controls to meet the standards demanded by Trans-Northern Operational Excellence Management System (OEMS)
Update manuals and drawings, and coordinate management of change as required by the scope of the work
Apply process engineering principles to resolve pipeline operation problems and improve performance
Facilitate risk assessment sessions and compile, analyze, and present solutions as part of a risk assessment
Ensure compliance with all regulations and codes and preparation of reports and presentations
Preparation of studies to determine the optimum solution to resolving pipeline concerns. Principally this involves cost estimating, hydraulic optimization, operation controls and drawing preparation
Provide assistance in preparation and presentation of approval applications to the CER (Canada Energy Regulator) or AER (Alberta Energy Regulator)
Perform incident investigations and corrective actions implementation
SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE:
Minimum Bachelor of Engineering (B.Eng) or Applied Science; Mechanical or Chemical Engineering degree is preferred
P. Eng, is preferred
Experienced in process design, control, and optimization
Hydraulic analysis and relevant software (SPS, AFT Fathom/Impulse) experience is preferred
Familiar with risk assessment techniques
Experienced in pipeline design and related equipment sizing
Familiar with applicable industry codes and standards such as CSA Z662, CER Pipeline regulations, API, ASME
Experienced in Pipeline Operation and Maintenance
Understanding and demonstration of safety principles and standards
Broad analytical, problem solving and trouble-shooting capability with critical decision making
Must be a team player with a track record of effective implementation within a multi-discipline team environment
Effective Non-Authoritative Leadership (NAL) skills
Self-starter –able to initiate, recommend and gain support for implementation of solutions and improvements
Demonstrated ability to effectively network to seek out and implement best practices and technology
Ability to coordinate & work with a sustained effort to meet deadlines and understand impact if not attained
Ability to manage time & resources to address numerous issues & work processes simultaneously
Ability to anticipate potential problems & opportunities
Ability to identify and implement “fit for purpose” solutions in a smaller company
Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal/team skills
Strong working knowledge of MS Office
WORKING CONDITIONS
Position will be based in Richmond Hill, ON
Driving and/or travel required throughout Ontario/Quebec/Alberta.
MORE OF WHAT WE OFFER
Work in a small, highly competent team whose members share your high sense of commitment.
Industry-competitive compensation.
We are an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.
Job Type: Full time, Temporary

Title: Geotechnical Engineer-In-Training - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
KGS Group is seeking a
Geotechnical Engineer-in-Training
to join our well-established Geotechnical Department in Mississauga, ON.
About Us
We are KGS Group, an employee-owned, multidisciplinary engineering consulting firm serving clients throughout North America. We’re different than traditional engineering firms. We believe a commitment to lasting relationships is just as critical as the expertise applied in our work. To us that means we put our clients and people first. We have the discipline to consistently deliver KGS Quality, never taking the easy way out. We always look closer and dig deeper. And no matter the project, we care enough to do it right.
As an employee-owned company, we’re invested in our work and our people. Working with us means you’ll be part of some of the most interesting projects across Canada, the U.S. and beyond. With the extensive, wide-ranging expertise within our company, you’ll have countless opportunities to learn and grow.
The Role
The Geotechnical Engineer-in-Training will be a recent University graduate who is interested in pursuing a career in geotechnical engineering. In this role you will have the opportunity to perform geotechnical and geologic evaluations and calculations, write technical documents, conduct subsurface investigations, and provide field monitoring, testing, and sampling for a variety of projects.
Your Key Responsibilities:
Assisting with scoping, developing budget, executing, monitoring and interpreting subsurface exploration programs
Field work involving monitoring and logging test boring explorations including visual identification and classification of soil and rock materials and preparation of boring logs using multiple logging software programs
Install and monitor geotechnical instrumentation systems
Review and interpret the results from geotechnical laboratory testing programs
Perform geotechnical calculations and analyses involving interpretation of subsurface conditions, soil mechanics, foundation engineering and slope stabilization
Perform geotechnical analyses with computer models for slope/embankment stability, braced excavations, pile and drilled shaft foundation capacities, shallow foundation capacities, MSE wall foundation design and foundation/embankment settlement estimates
Prepare geotechnical data reports and report-quality calculation packages
Write technical reports, design memoranda, field reports, cost estimating, specifications and permit documents
Safely perform work in the office and field; fieldwork may occur in all seasonal weather conditions, using equipment (with an ability to lift and move approximately 50 pounds without assistance) and operating vehicles on behalf of the company
Willing and able to work extended hours, when needed, to meet deadlines
Ability and interest in travelling with possible short-term or long-term assignments at project sites
About You
Qualifications to fill the role could include:
Bachelor’s degree in Civil, Geotechnical, or Geological Engineering. Post-graduate degree M.Sc. and/or Ph.D. in Civil/Geotechnical engineering will be considered an asset.
Engineer-in-Training (EIT) or Engineering Intern (EI) designation or an ability to obtain within two years.
Academic or professional training in soil mechanics, foundation engineering with emphasis in several of the following areas: geology, subsurface investigations, geotechnical laboratory testing, mechanics of materials, foundation design, slope stability analyses, soil and rock slope stabilization, earth support structures, geomorphology and surveying/GIS.
0-3 years’ experience in the geology, geotechnical, civil, or dam engineering fields, to include: field logging and sampling, slope stability, settlement, earth retaining structure, foundations, general civil design, construction, or other geotechnical analyses.
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint software.
Some exposure to or knowledge of numerical modeling and finite element analysis, and computer aided design drafting.
Demonstrated ability to work independently with limited senior oversight.
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work with a team or with minimal supervision, and with contractors and multi-disciplinary environment, with a willingness to perform a variety of assignments on short notice with a positive attitude.
Strong attention to detail; accuracy is essential.
Focused organization and time management abilities.
Excellent verbal and strong writing skills.
Understanding the importance of health & safety as a top priority.
Valid Driver’s License.
KGS Group is an employee-owned equal opportunity company offering an excellent compensation and benefits package.
KGS Group welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Upon request, KGS Group will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

Title: Field Engineer - Greater Sudbury, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Come work with us!
Regulvar is a leader in building automation and in green building revolution backed with almost 5 decades of proven experience.
We are a big family of more than 600 committed employees throughout Ontario and Quebec including 65 engineers, 180 technicians, etc. that thrives with a strong team spirit to create value for building users and owners.
*
Discover the job!*
We are looking for a Field Engineer, specialized in mechanical systems, building automation, instrumentation, and integration, to join our team in Sudbury.
Our projects include different areas such as ventilation, boiler plants, chiller plants, geothermal energy, solar energy (thermal and voltaic), access controls, lighting, and the latest technological innovations (IoT, Data Analytics, Cloud) to meet our clients' expectations.
*
What you’ll do?*
You will be responsible for, but not limited to:
*
Establish, monitor, and implement building control solutions emphasizing on energy and operational efficiency as part of a team.
Test and verify the quality of installations.
Perform system and equipment start-ups and complete the related documentation.
Tune PID loops.
Complete programming of Delta digital control systems.
Make graphical modifications.
Perform calibration and maintenance of detection and actuation devices.
Focus on product lifecycle service (troubleshoot, repair, train end-users, and upgrade equipment)
Install and terminate control devices, such as control panels, sensors, actuators, and relays.
Install wires and conduits.
Respect all health and safety policies.
*
Must have: *
Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering or related field.
Knowledge of building mechanical / electrical systems.
Knowledge of programmable logic controllers (PLCs) and direct digital controllers (DDC).
Knowledge of electronic components.
Knowledge in general-purpose programming languages such as BASIC and C++.
Ability to perform physical job-related tasks.
Valid driver's licence.
Good sense of organization and planning.
Ability to work in a team.
Knowledge of the Office suite.
Great sense of customer service.
Good communication skills, written and spoken.
*
Nice to have: *
Experience in building automation, building mechanics, instrumentation and control.
Knowledge of HVAC.
Knowledge of Delta products.
Knowledge of computer and telecommunication networks.
WHMIS/SIMDUT 2015.
Completed training in Health and Safety course.
Completed training in Working at Heights course.
*
Why join our team?*
We are offering a stable job with great working conditions.
We provide a competitive group Insurance + dental and eye care plan.
We offer a retirement plan (RRSP) with the employer contribution to help build and enhance your future financial security.
We are a growing company, and we’ll help you to grow your capacity with us through our employee continuous training programs.
We have stimulating work challenges that match your talent.
We have a strong bonded terrific and dynamic team.
*
Let’s hear about you! Apply now*
The candidate must be available to work full-time in Sudbury and available to travel within Ontario.
*
Our values*
We believe and commit ourselves in creating a diverse environment where everyone is included. Regulvar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
_
In this document, the use of the masculine gender to refer to persons is intended solely for the sake of brevity and identifies individuals of both sexes without discrimination._
_
Regulvar subscribes to the principle of employment equity and invites all qualified individuals to submit their application. Consequently, Regulvar welcomes applications from women, Aboriginal peoples, ethnic minorities, people with disabilities, people of all orientations and gender identities, visible minorities and others who could contribute to greater diversity._
_
Only candidates authorized to work in the province and country where this position is located will be considered._
_
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for consideration will be contacted._

Title: Senior Process Engineer - Alberta - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Description
Sacré-Davey is a privately held, multi-disciplinary engineering and project management firm that services the mining, energy, and general industrial sectors. With offices in Canada, the United States, and the Philippines, we offer our clients professional services and global technical expertise to de-risk and maximize the value of their projects.
The diverse range of projects that we deliver include mineral processing plants, green and blue hydrogen production facilities, wastewater treatment plants, technology scale-up, renewable fuels, GHG reduction, power generation facilities, bulk material terminals and food processing plants.
We strive to deliver projects with excellence and help our clients grow and succeed with a focus on sustainability and responsible development. We are on a mission to create a more sustainable future for us all and need talented professionals to help us reach our goals.
Job Description
As the Senior Process Engineer your role is to assist in the leadership and management of staff within the process team on major projects. Reporting to the Lead Process Engineer you will be integral to success of major projects within the renewables space. To be successful in this role you will need to be familiar with refinery processes, unit operation, utility design and have the ability to report progress.
We are open to working remotely for candidates located anywhere in central and western North America however some travel may be required based on the needs of projects and clients.
This is a 6 month contract position to fulfill an immediate project need.
Responsibilities
Involved on all technical aspects of process engineering work, such as development of process design criteria, preparation of engineering calculations, analyses, and studies, development of process simulations, PFD’s and P&ID’s, HAZOP attendance/input, equipment sizing and specifications, and report writing.
Review and confirm engineering deliverables are complete, technically accurate, and in compliance with applicable codes, standards, and specifications.
Produce cost estimates, schedules, and other documentation to support project development.
Manage the process engineering discipline ensuring that the project deliverables and quality are met while staying within budget.
Manage and troubleshoot the assignment of hours to subordinates; communicate effectively with Project Management and engineering discipline to ensure that process deliverables can be achieved through the assigned hours.
Provide mentoring and development for junior and intermediate engineers.
Understand and implement all relevant systems, standards, practices, and procedures.
Travel to project sites, on a short term basis, as required.
Maintain health, safety and environmental focus to ensure that these elements are embedded in the design and procurement processes.
Qualifications
Must be legally eligible to work in Canada or the USA
10-15 years of relevant technical and managerial experience
Bachelor’s degree in applicable field from a recognized institution
Registered as a Professional Engineer either in Canada with a preference for a PE designation in the US
Experience with complex downstream oil refining facilities
Experience delivering major projects (at least to 200MM TIC)
Team builder and facilitator, skilled in interpersonal interactions and presentations
Ability to effectively communicate and positively guide team members, articulate and highly proficient language skills
Ability to travel to customer sites and all SDE Regional Offices
Proactive with a high degree of initiative, highly organized, with the ability to handle multiple tasks
Additional Information
Sacré-Davey offers a competitive compensation package, as well as a creative, cohesive work environment and continuous opportunity for development. If you would like to be considered for this opportunity please submit your resume and cover letter, including a description of projects and accomplishments relevant to the position.
Sacré-Davey is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected status. If you have any accessibility or special requirements, please let us know and we will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.

Title: Commissioning Engineer-In-Training - Saskatoon, SK - Indeed.com
Description:
Requisition ID:
49567
Job Category:
Commissioning
With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we understand that challenges are changing rapidly in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff with experience in over 150 countries to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.
Our Project Delivery Group (PDG) helps clients reach their business goals through a range of strong technical capabilities. We ensure world-class project delivery through the skills of our people, methodologies, governance, and systems. Our engineering and project management and construction disciplines ensure safe, efficient, and sustainable delivery of projects globally across the metals and mining, infrastructure, and energy sectors.
We manage our clients’ entire project lifecycle from studies to building assets, operating the assets, and developing efficiencies.
Join our team and become part of a community that strives for positive change–providing the best solutions for our clients’ toughest challenges!
Title: Commissioning EIT (Engineering new graduate) – Saskatoon, SK
Position Summary:
Hatch is seeking a Commissioning EIT with interest in metals, mining, energy, water treatment and/or infrastructure. Reporting to the Regional Director of Commissioning for Western Canada the EIT will support commissioning projects in the Western Canada region working from the Saskatoon office and at project offices as required.
What Will a Career at Hatch Offer You:
You will:
Be given opportunities to contribute to complex projects around the world in meaningful ways
Work on problems and gain experience in the office and on project sites
Collaborate with diverse teams locally and globally
Work in an exciting environment where you can apply your academic learning on a daily basis
Gain relevant experience and support in obtaining your professional designation
Benefit from formal and informal mentorship from some of the leading minds and authorities in the industry
Participate in local Professional Development Programs, Sustainability Week, Toastmasters, and more to develop your skills
Join in charitable, social, and sports activities with other Hatch employees
We’re entrepreneurs with a technical soul. Our flat organizational structure creates an atmosphere of openness and participation. We build practical solutions that are safe, innovative, and sustainable. Our ultimate goal is to achieve no harm for our people, our clients, and our communities.
Responsibilities:
Support commissioning planning and setup activities
Provide technical input for testing and data collection during the pre-commissioning and commissioning phase of the project
Lead technology development initiatives in the group including investigating of alternate and supporting commissioning software
Lead setup and implementation of the commissioning management system and become a support resource for global projects on the corresponding software(s)
Provide input to technology initiatives to improve the efficiency of the commissioning process and a different perspective on approaches to execution
Develop test plans and commissioning procedures
Participate in field testing and troubleshoot/optimize equipment that is not performing
Manage the test results, data collection, progress measurement and documentation of results
Support development of commissioning estimates, budgets, forecasts, schedules, commissioning proposals and presentations
Coordinate with construction planning team to align commissioning systems are coordinated with construction work packages, engineering and procurement
Review P&IDs, Flow Diagrams, Single Line Diagram, Network Architecture Drawings and engineering registers to prepare an execution plan and estimate to execute pre-commissioning and commissioning services and identify opportunities for project acceleration
Establish the commissioning requirements for pre-fabrication and modularization.
Education and Experience:
A new graduate with a Bachelor of Engineering or Bachelor of Applied Science in Chemical, Process, Mechanical, Metallurgical, or Mining Engineering
Excel academically while being actively involved in extra-curricular and/or volunteer activities at school or in the community
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications. Experience using Visio or similar tools to communicate commissioning sequence, organizational charts and work flow processes is an asset
Effective report writing skills, planning and organizational skills
Previous co-op experience in project execution, commissioning, or construction on industrial project is considered an asset
This role requires some travel to various Hatch offices, project and supplier sites subject to project requirements
Aspirations of becoming a commissioning manager, project manager or group lead are considered an asset
Competencies (knowledge, skill, attributes):
Good understanding of engineering and business fundamentals as they apply to engineering problems and projects
Ability to learn quickly and to take on new challenges
Collaborative team player with excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Shows critical and creative thinking and problem solving, and brings forward solutions for our clients' toughest challenges
Adapts and embraces change
NOTE: Note: You must
submit a transcript
(official or unofficial) upon application to be considered for role.
We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected status. If you have any special needs requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.

Title: Project Engineer - North Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Description
Sacré-Davey is a privately held, multi-disciplinary engineering and project management firm that services the mining, energy, and general industrial sectors. With offices in Canada, the United States, and the Philippines, we offer our clients professional services and global technical expertise to de-risk and maximize the value of their projects.
The diverse range of projects that we deliver include mineral processing plants, green and blue hydrogen production facilities, wastewater treatment plants, technology scale-up, renewable fuels, GHG reduction, power generation facilities, bulk material terminals and food processing plants.
We strive to deliver projects with excellence and help our clients grow and succeed with a focus on sustainability and responsible development. We are on a mission to create a more sustainable future for us all and need talented professionals to help us reach our goals.
Job Description
As a member of the Project Management Office, the Project Engineer acts as the technical lead on a variety of projects, helping our clients execute their capital and maintenance projects to meet their operational needs. Engaging directly with clients from the tender stage, the Project Engineer establishes project technical objectives & constraints and supports the Project Manager in developing effective project plans, in accordance with SDE’s and Clients’ workflows. Comfortable on-site as well as making technical presentations in the boardroom or web-conferences, the Project Engineer understands how our clients’ businesses work.
The successful candidate is a self-learner that stays up to date with current technologies in industry, and is self-motivated to guide specialist technical staff on projects from kick-off to close-out.
Responsibilities:
Act as the “voice of the customer” for all technical deliverables
Guides internal multi-disciplinary teams comprised of staff, contractors, and vendors to deliver creative and cost-effective solutions for our clients
Encourages and fosters multi-disciplinary discussions & collaboration
Identifies and removes roadblocks for internal and client project teams to advance their work
Communicates and guides team members with a clear vision of what a successful project outcome looks like for the client
Ensure that the project deliverables align with what a successful project outcome looks like for the client
Ensure the project deliverables meet and exceed SDE’s standards for quality, with feedback to ensure projects are delivered on budget and schedule
Supports the Project Manager on assigned projects
Manages project change through SDE’s Engineering Change process
Creating and delivering technical presentations to internal stake holders and clients
Visiting work sites as required
Turning broad and ambiguous needs of clients into clear objectives for SDE engineering teams to develop solutions in the form of designs, drawings, and construction work packages
Supporting projects in a variety of market sectors covering general industrial, manufacturing, ports and marine, energy (renewables, hydrogen, cogeneration, and oil & gas), and mining & mineral exploration
Qualifications
Technical
Must be legally eligible to work in Canada
Minimum Bachelor’s degree in one or more engineering disciplines from an accredited university.
Working knowledge of all core disciplines that are needed to complete a complex project with the ability to articulate themselves accordingly
Registered, or eligible to register, as a Professional Engineer in BC and/or AB.
Minimum 7 years of engineering experience, with 2-3 years in relevant industry sectors.
Experience and proficiency in engineering to Canadian codes and standards,
Ability to working independently on small/medium sized projects and with other Project Engineers on larger assignments
Previous onsite experience considered an asset.
Experience across multiple industries considered an asset.
General:
Strong leadership, interpersonal and problem-solving skills.
Strong professional standards, with proficiency in engineering theory and practice.
Organizational skills, with effective communication and coordination with team.
Proficient and professional communication in oral English, written presentation, technical sketching
Time management and multi-tasking skills with the ability to work to schedules and budgets.
Additional Information
Sacré-Davey offers a competitive compensation package, as well as a creative, cohesive work environment and continuous opportunity for development. If you would like to be considered for this opportunity please submit your resume and cover letter, including a description of projects and accomplishments relevant to the position.
Sacré-Davey is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected status. If you have any accessibility or special requirements, please let us know and we will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.
